article.headline: Robert Morris 76, St. Francis, Pa. 68
article.story: CORAOPOLIS, Pa. (AP) -- A.J. Jackson had 22 points and 10 rebounds as Robert Morris handed St. Francis of Pennsylvania its 14th consecutive defeat, 76-68, on Saturday. Senior J.R. Enright had a career-high 22 points for the Red Flash, who have not won since Dec. 16 and have dropped all 11 Northeast Conference games since winning their conference opener Dec. 7. Robert Morris (14-7, 6-6) took a 25-9 lead before St. Francis (4-19, 1-11) used a 10-0 run that spanned halftime to tie the game at 39. St. Francis took its only lead of the contest -- 60-58 -- with 5:08 to play after a 13-7 run. But Robert Morris answered with a 12-2 run to put the game away. The Colonials got 20 points from Jeremy Chappell and 19 from Tony Lee. Chappell added seven rebounds, five assists and four steals. Robert Morris shot 50 percent from the field and made 26 of 29 from the free throw line but was only made 4-for-15 from 3-point range. Robert Morris had lost its previous two contests, but have still not had a three-game losing streak this season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
